title: MySQLGREATEST()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLGREATEST()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the greatest value of the list of arguments:
SELECT GREATEST(3, 12, 34, 8, 25);

Definition and Usage
The GREATEST() function returns the greatest value of the list of arguments.
Note:
See also the
LEAST()
function.
Syntax
GREATEST(
arg1
,
arg2
,
arg3
, ...)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
arg1
,
arg2
,
arg3
, ...
Required. The list of arguments to be evaluated
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the greatest value of the list of arguments:
SELECT GREATEST(".com", "microsoft.com", "apple.com");

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLGREATEST()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLGREATEST()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLGREATEST()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
